content: chmodonly directories find * -type d -exec chmod 755 {} + only files find * -type f -exec chmod 644 {} + use fd to batch process, use -X instead of -x fd -t d -X chmod 755 {} fd -t f -X chmod 644 {}

content: tmuxinstall tpm git clone https://github.com/tmux-plugins/tpm ~/.tmux/plugins/tpm in ~/.tmux.conf set -g @plugin 'tmux-plugins/tpm' set -g @plugin 'wfxr/tmux-power' set-option -g default-shell /usr/bin/fish # kill sessions automatically set-option -g destroy-unattached set -g @tmux_power_theme 'moon' # send prefix set-option -g prefix C-a unbind-key C-a bind-key C-a send-prefix # use Alt-arrow keys to switch panes bind -n M-Left select-pane -L bind -n M-Right select-pane -R bind -n M-Up select-pane -U bind -n M-Down select-pane -D # Shift arrow to switch windows bind -n S-Left previous-window bind -n S-Right next-window # mouse mode setw -g mouse on # set easier window split keys bind-key v split-window -h bind-key h split-window -v # easy config reload bind-key r source-file ~/.tmux.conf \; display-message "~/.tmux.conf reloaded." run '~/.tmux/plugins/tpm/tpm' reload .tmux.conf and press prefix + I(Capital i) to install plugins kill all tmux windows tmux kill-server enter vi mode prefix + [ quit vi mode q

content: ethinstall iwd for iwctl yay -S iwd start iwd sudo systemctl start iwd iwctl device list you will see: [iwd]# device list Devices * -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Name Address Powered Adapter Mode -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- wlan0 3a:68:8f:72:6d:df off phy0 station if it is powered off [iwd]# adapter phy0 set-property Powered on and run device list again [iwd]# device list Devices * -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Name Address Powered Adapter Mode -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- wlan0 3a:68:8f:72:6d:df on phy0 station [iwd]# station wlan0 scan [iwd]# station wlan0 get-networks you will see network lists [iwd]# station wlan0 get-networks Available networks -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Network name Security Signal -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- > IAN-2 psk **** js-3F psk **** Media Control System psk **** 4FWDC20 psk **** HP-Print-85-LaserJet 1102 open **** choose the network [iwd]# station wlan0 connect IAN-2 that’s done next, install wireless_tools for iwconfig yay -S wireless_tools iwconfig lo no wireless extensions. enp3s0 no wireless extensions. wlan0 IEEE 802.11 ESSID:"IAN-2" Mode:Managed Frequency:2.412 GHz Access Point: 6C:19:8F:E1:65:44 Bit Rate=1 Mb/s Tx-Power=22 dBm Retry short limit:7 RTS thr:off Fragment thr:off Power Management:on Link Quality=56/70 Signal level=-54 dBm Rx invalid nwid:0 Rx invalid crypt:0 Rx invalid frag:0 Tx excessive retries:0 Invalid misc:1 Missed beacon:0 choose wlan0 if you want to close the wifi: [iwd]# adapter phy0 set-property Powered off

content: Config Before Installationmake terminal font bigger cd /usr/share/kbd/consolefonts/ setfont ter-d20b.psf.gz in /etc/makepkg.conf MAKEFLAGS="-j$(expr $(nproc) \+ 1)" in /etc/pacman.conf Color ParallelDownloads = 5 [core] Server = http://archlinux.cs.nctu.edu.tw/$repo/os/$arch Include = /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist [extra] Server = http://archlinux.cs.nctu.edu.tw/$repo/os/$arch Include = /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist #[community-testing] #Include = /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist [community] Server = http://archlinux.cs.nctu.edu.tw/$repo/os/$arch Include = /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist pacman -Syy
title: Arch Linux Installation

content: Partition
title: Arch Linux Installation

content: UEFI System fdisk -l device Size ID Type /dev/sda1 512M ef EFI (FAT-12/16/32) /dev/sda2 4G 82 Linux Swap /Solaris /dev/sda3 35.5G 83 Linux mkfs.fat -F32 /dev/sda1 mkswap /dev/sda2 swapon /dev/sda2 mkfs.ext4 /dev/sda3
title: Arch Linux Installation

content: Non-UEFI SystemCreating filesystem for non-UEFI system For non-UEFI system, you only have one single root partition. So just make it ext4: mkfs.ext4 /dev/sda1
title: Arch Linux Installation

content: Mount to /mnt mount /dev/sda3 /mnt pacstrap /mnt base linux linux-firmware vim genfstab -U /mnt >> /mnt/etc/fstab arch-chroot /mnt

content: Set Time and Locale ln -sf /usr/share/zoneinfo/Asia/Taipei /etc/localtime vim /etc/locale.gen # uncomment this line en_US.UTF-8 UTF-8 locale-gen echo LANG=en_US.UTF-8 > /etc/locale.conf the name is the computer’s name echo myarch > /etc/hostname vim /etc/hosts 127.0.0.1 localhost ::1 localhost 127.0.1.1 myarch passwd

content: Install Grub Boot Loader
title: Arch Linux Installation

content: UEFI System pacman -S grub efibootmgr mkdir /boot/efi mount /dev/sda1 /boot/efi grub-install --target=x86_64-efi --bootloader-id=GRUB --efi-directory=/boot/efi grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg
title: Arch Linux Installation

content: Non-UEFI SystemInstall grub on Non-UEFI systems Install grub package first: pacman -S grub And then install grub like this (don’t put the disk number sda1, just the disk name sda): grub-install /dev/sda Last step: grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg
title: Arch Linux Installation
